Course Description: Initiation à la sélection, à l'administration et à l'interprétation des principaux tests associés à la psychologie du counselling et au counselling professionnel (planification de carrière, intérêts, aptitudes, attitudes, valeurs). Accent sur l'utilisation et l'interprétation quantitative et qualitative des tests utilisés.

Course Code: EDU 5686 Technologie en enseignement en santé (3 crédits)
Course Description: Étude des enjeux théoriques et pratiques liés à l’intégration des technologies en enseignement en santé. Examen des rôles et des identités professionnelles et d’apprenants en lien avec l’intégration des TIC selon différents contextes en enseignement en santé.

Course Code: EDU 5687 Modèles d'intégration des technologies de l'information et de la communication en contextes éducatif (3 crédits)
Course Description: Examen des mécanismes d'exploitation des technologies de l'information et de la communication (TIC) et de leurs liens avec les théories d'apprentissage. Analyse des pratiques exemplaires et des modèles émergents.

Course Code: EDU 5698 Stratégies d’évaluation des apprentissages en enseignement en santé (3 crédits)
Course Description: Étude des modèles utilisés pour évaluer les domaines de compétence clinique au cours de la formation des  professionnels de la santé, tant au niveau des études de premier cycle que des études supérieures. Analyse  des examens écrits et oraux et d'épreuves portant sur l'accomplissement de tâches.

Course Code: EDU 5699 Évaluation des programmes (3 crédits)
Course Description: Étude des notions de base sur la conception et la gestion de programmes. Analyse des aspects théoriques et pratiques de l'évaluation des programmes. Examens des modèles d évaluation, de la planification du projet d évaluation, de la rédaction du rapport d'évaluation et de la méta-évaluation.

Course Code: EDU 5701 Principes de planification systématique en enseignement aux professionnels de la santé, partie I (3 crédits)
Course Description: Exploration d'une démarche méthodique de planification, de mise sur pied et d'évaluation de programmes éducatifs pour les professionnels de la santé; réflexion sur l'analyse des besoins, les objectifs, les stratégies d'enseignement et d'évaluation des apprentissages et de programmes.

Course Code: EDU 5702 Principes de planification systématique en enseignement aux professionnels de la santé, partie II (3 crédits)
Course Description: Exploration des concepts rattachés à la mise en oeuvre d'un changement dans un milieu éducatif, au choix des méthodes qui favorisent les apprentissages et au développement d'outils valides pour évaluer les apprentissages et les programmes d'études en santé.

Course Code: EDU 5752 Enseignement en milieu minoritaire francophone (3 crédits)
Course Description: Examen des enjeux reliés à l'apprentissage et l'enseignement en milieu minoritaire francophone permettant de préciser les démarches éducatives pertinentes.

Course Code: EDU 5757 Problématiques actuelles en enseignement et apprentissage des mathématiques (3 crédits)
Course Description: Étude des problématiques actuelles en éducation mathématique telles que l'équité, l'apprentissage par investigation, la diversité en salle de classe et le rôle de la technologie.

Course Code: EDU 5760 Compréhension et raisonnement mathématiques en milieu scolaire (3 crédits)
Course Description: Étude du développement de la pensée mathématique associée à différents concepts présents dans les programmes de mathématiques en milieu scolaire.

Course Code: EDU 5799 Élaboration d'instruments d'évaluation des apprentissages (3 crédits)
Course Description: Étude des modalités d'évaluation des connaissances, des attitudes, des performances et des compétences. Étude des stratégies d'élaboration d'instruments d'évaluation des apprentissages. Examen de la qualité des instruments élaborés.

Course Code: EDU 5830 Enjeux actuels en administration éducationnelle (3 crédits)
Course Description: Application des théories et principes en administration éducationnelle à partir de problèmes, d'événements et de politiques éducationnelles récents.

Course Code: EDU 5832 Développement des relations avec la communauté scolaire (3 crédits)
Course Description: Examen de l'importance des relations avec la communauté scolaire. Approfondissement du concept de partenariat, des modèles de répartition des pouvoirs, des techniques de communication efficace, du marketing des produits éducatifs et du concept de client et d'usager.

Course Code: EDU 5833 Éducation et changement social (3 crédits)
Course Description: Étude de l'impact des changements sociaux, technologiques, économiques, législatifs et médiatiques sur l'éducation. Redéfinition des liens entre l'école et la société. Examen des nouvelles réalités pédagogiques à l'ère de l'information.

Course Code: EDU 5871 Développement des habiletés en counselling et psychothérapie (3 crédits)
Course Description: Étude des principales approches en counselling et psychothérapie dans un contexte d'acquisition des techniques d'interventions qui y sont associées. Accent mis sur le développement des ressources personnelles tant sur le plan verbal que sur le plan non verbal.

Course Code: EDU 5873 Théories du choix de carrière (3 crédits)
Course Description: Une analyse du développement professionnel avec insistance sur les problèmes du choix de carrière et d'adaptation.

Course Code: EDU 5881 Tendances de la recherche en éducation inclusive (3 crédits)
Course Description: Fondements théoriques et enjeux actuels de l'approche inclusive à l'éducation. Perspectives des élèves, du personnel scolaire, des intervenant/es communautaires et associatifs/ves et des parents.

Course Code: EDU 5899 Enjeux actuels en évaluation des apprentissages (3 crédits)
Course Description: Étude des principes, politiques et concepts courants en évaluation des apprentissages. Examen critique d'application des procédures dans diverses situations actuelles d'évaluation. Approfondissement de problématiques en salle de classe et en contexte des évaluations à grande échelle.

Course Code: EDU 6101 Seminar in Health Professions Education (3 units)
Course Description: Critical examination of selected topics in health professions education based on research and disciplinary issues. (Open to MEd Students with permission of the program director).

Course Code: EDU 6102 Seminar in Curriculum Studies (3 units)
Course Description: (Organizational Studies in Education)    Critical examination of research within the field of curriculum studies.

Course Code: EDU 6103 Researching Professional Practice (3 units)
Course Description: (Teaching, Learning and Evaluation)    Critical examination of the scholarship and research on professional practice of teaching, its application to knowledge building and pedagogical improvement.

Course Code: EDU 6106 Science, Technology, Society and Environment (3 units)
Course Description: (Teaching, Learning and Evaluation)  Critical examination of the social impact of science and technology and their  educational implications. Study of the roles of ecological and scientific literacies.

Course Code: EDU 6107 Diverse perspectives in health and physical education (3 units)
Course Description: Research in health and physical education from diverse perspectives and their implications for pedagogy

Course Code: EDU 6109 Youth Culture, Popular Culture and Pedagogy (3 units)
Course Description: (Society, Culture and Literacies) Research in youth culture, popular culture and their implications for pedagogy.

Course Code: EDU 6110 Curriculum, Politics and Policy in Education (3 units)
Course Description: (Organizational Studies in Education)  Critical study of the political organization of education; the role of government in shaping curriculum; the cultural politics of educational change.

Course Code: EDU 6111 Teaching and learning as second languages in cultural contexts (3 units)
Course Description: Critical analysis of pedagogical practices and concepts related to teaching, learning and evaluating in various second/additional language cultural contexts. Studies of different trends and related concepts.

Course Code: EDU 6146 Second Language Learning Theories (3 units)
Course Description: Critical study of second/additional language learning theories from linguistics, cognitive and social perspectives in educational context.

Course Code: EDU 6191 Quantitative Research (3 units)
Course Description: An introduction to planning, analysis and interpretation of quantitative research within experimental, quasi-experimental, observational, and mixed method designs.

Course Code: EDU 6193 Foundations of Measurement and Testing (3 units)
Course Description: Classical test theory; composite variables; reliability; validity; applications to norm-referenced and criterion-referenced tests; scales standardization.

Course Code: EDU 6200 The Adult Educator: Roles and Behavior (3 units)
Course Description: Study of functions and tasks, and the various roles of adult educators as volunteers, as trainers, as teachers of adults, as researchers; examination of the pre service and on going training of adult educators and professionalization in adult education.

Course Code: EDU 6203 Learning and Literacies (3 units)
Course Description: Examination of literacy in relation to the construction of ethnicity, gender, social class and racialized difference; exploration of literacy theories from historical, psychological, political and educational perspectives; study of school, family, workplace and community literacy practices.

Course Code: EDU 6204 Learning in Adulthood (3 units)
Course Description: Examination of theories and stages of adulthood with emphasis on adult psychological development and implications for education. Critical study of adult characteristics, motivation, gender roles and other concepts related to development.

Course Code: EDU 6241 Second in Language Program and Policy Development and Evaluation (3 units)
Course Description: Study of second language policy and how it affects program design and implementation; needs analysis, setting goals and objectives, syllabus design, materials development and classroom implementation; learning assessment, program evaluation and revision.

Course Code: EDU 6271 Counselling and Psychotherapy: Theories and Practices II (3 units)
Course Description: Advanced critical examination of major personality and counselling theories.

Course Code: EDU 6290 Research Methodologies (3 units)
Course Description: Critical study of epistemological and methodological foundations of research, implications for ethics and research design. (Reserved for MA and MRP students.)

Course Code: EDU 6293 Assessment for Learning (3 units)
Course Description: Nature and role of formative assessment in instructional settings; conditions and contexts favorable for effective use of assessment for learning.

Course Code: EDU 6299 Program Evaluation: Theory and Contemporary Issues (3 units)
Course Description: Critical exploration of theoretical orientations to program evaluation and in-depth examination of selected contemporary issues confronting evaluators.

Course Code: EDU 6371 Selected Topics in Counselling Psychology (3 units)
Course Description: An examination of current issues in counselling psychology.

Course Code: EDU 6372 Models of Consultation and Case Management in Educational Counselling (3 units)
Course Description: Analysis of the roles of a counsellor as a leader, a team member, and an integral resource in developing, mobilizing, and/or utilizing school/community resources within a systems approach; personal development of the skills of co-ordination, collaboration, brokering, and consultation.

Course Code: EDU 6373 Education of Marginalized Youth (3 units)
Course Description: Examination of the social ecology and educational problems and needs of diverse groups of marginalized youth in different contexts in Canada and in other countries; related socio-political issues, policy implications, and intervention strategies.

Course Code: EDU 6375 Psychopathology and Assessment (3 units)
Course Description: Critical analysis of diagnostic features and assessment of psychological disorders including: etiology, symptomatology, prevalence, as well as the methods and instruments for clinical evaluation.

Course Code: EDU 6421 Public Memory, Lived Histories and Education (3 units)
Course Description: Critical examination of the social construction of public memory through schooling; relations between public memory, peoples' lived histories and the making of communities; the roles of public memory in shaping social identities of race, nation and gender.

Course Code: EDU 6422 Education and Democratic Communities (3 units)
Course Description: Inquiry into the democratic purposes of schooling and the theory and practices of democratic education; implications for civic engagement, curriculum, school organizations and leadership.

Course Code: EDU 6426 Citizenship and Global Education (3 units)
Course Description: Theories of citizenship, global education and their related pedagogies.

Course Code: EDU 6428 Social Contexts of Education (3 units)
Course Description: Examination of education and its role as part of the fabric of society; exploration of changing norms of schooling, school organization, and social environments; the effects of schooling on social stratification, the relationships between schools and other social institutions, and the paradoxes of education in pluralistic societies; inquiry into issues of authority, power, socialization and culture.

Course Code: EDU 6429 Pedagogies of Difference (3 units)
Course Description: Exploration of diversity and education from cultural, economic, historical and political perspectives including critical pedagogy and pedagogies of transformation.

Course Code: EDU 6460 Inquiries in Between Curriculum, Culture and Language (3 units)
Course Description: Examination of the ways in which curriculum works to reproduce and/or suppress certain identities; interdisciplinary inquiries into how current curricular language is situated in relation to identity formations; deconstruction of the marginalization of identities across various curricular contexts.

Course Code: EDU 6470 Multicultural Counselling (3 units)
Course Description: Exploration of practical and theoretical issues relevant to counselling individuals, groups, and families from diverse cultural backgrounds. Emphasis on development of attitudes, values, and skills that promote effective interpersonal relations and counselling.

Course Code: EDU 6472 Seminar and Practicum in Group Counselling (3 units)
Course Description: Examination of group counselling theory and technique; emphasis on dynamics of group behaviour, social-psychological interactions in small groups, and practice in developing and providing group counselling services.

Course Code: EDU 6473 Practicum in Counselling Psychology I (3 units)
Course Description: Seminar and minimum of 200 hours of supervised on-site experience in an approved counselling setting. Examination of organizational issues in the delivery of counselling and psychotherapy services; development of professional competence.

Course Code: EDU 6474 Practicum in Counselling Psychology II (3 units)
Course Description: Seminar and minimum of 200 hours of supervised on-site experience in an approved counselling setting. Critical examination of selected helping techniques; critical examination of ethical and legal issues in counselling psychology.

Course Code: EDU 6501 Séminaire en enseignement aux professionnels de la santé (3 crédits)
Course Description: Examen critique des thèmes reliés à l'enseignement aux professionnels de la santé et inspirés de la recherche et des enjeux disciplinaires. (Ouvert aux étudiantes et étudiants du M. Éd. avec la permission du directeur des études supérieures).

Course Code: EDU 6504 Éducation dans une perspective historique (3 crédits)
Course Description: (Société, culture et littératies)  Étude du rôle de la langue, de la culture, de l'ethnicité, du genre et de la religion dans le développement de l'éducation en milieu majoritaire et minoritaire au Canada et dans le monde. Analyse de diverses perspectives en histoire de l'éducation.

Course Code: EDU 6505 Enjeux actuels en enseignement (3 crédits)
Course Description: (Enseignement, apprentissage et évaluation)  Étude des problématiques actuelles en éducation et de leurs enjeux en enseignement.

Course Code: EDU 6506 Sciences technologies, société et environnement (3 crédits)
Course Description: (Enseignement, apprentissage et évaluation) Examen critique de l'impact social des sciences et des technologies, et leur implication éducationnelle. Rôle des littératies écologiques et scientifiques.

Course Code: EDU 6508 Perspectives de la didactique du français langue seconde en contextes nationaux (3 crédits)
Course Description: Étude des particularités de l'enseignement et de l'apprentissage du français langue seconde au Canada. Analyse des conditions qui favorisent l'enseignement et l'apprentissage du français langue seconde parmi diverses populations et dans différents contextes.

Course Code: EDU 6511 Enseignement et apprentissage des littératies en langues secondes selon les contextes culturels (3 crédits)
Course Description: Analyse critique de pratiques pédagogiques liées à l'enseignement, à l'apprentissage et à l'évaluation des langues secondes en fonction de différents contextes culturels. Étude de divers courants et concepts qui s'y rattachent.

Course Code: EDU 6516 Enseignement et apprentissage de la grammaire du français langue seconde (3 crédits)
Course Description: Analyse des pratiques pédagogiques portant sur la langue orale et écrite. Étude critique de la recherche sur l'enseignement du français oral et écrit en langue seconde.

Course Code: EDU 6529 Approches théoriques et pratiques en littératies multiples (3 crédits)
Course Description: Études des approches théoriques et pratiques associées aux différents champs des littératies tels que la littératie familiale, scolaire, personnelle et critique.

Course Code: EDU 6530 Interprofessionnalisme en enseignement en santé (3 crédits)
Course Description: Étude des fondements et des théories de l’interprofessionnalisme en enseignement en santé. Études des principes généraux de l’enseignement interprofessionnel en santé et de ses modalités, dont la simulation. Analyse de modèles de compétences interprofessionnelles en santé. Étude des rôles et de l’identité professionnelle en santé. Élaboration de l’enseignement l’interprofessionnalisme. Initiation au choix d’instruments de mesure et d’évaluation des compétences interprofessionnelles. Rappel de principes généraux de la recherche interprofessionnelle et de l’approche de recherche collaborative.

Course Code: EDU 6531 Enseigner en santé (partie 1) (3 crédits)
Course Description: Étude de la physiologie de l’apprentissage. Étude des fondements et des théories pédagogiques appliqués en enseignement en santé. Étude des éléments fondamentaux et de la planification systématique en enseignement en santé. Analyse des compétences requises pour accomplir les tâches professionnelles en enseignement en santé. Étude du parallèle entre la pratique clinique et la pratique éducative.

Course Code: EDU 6532 Enseigner en santé (partie 2) (3 crédits)
Course Description: Intégration des principes et des notions pédagogiques dans la planification systématique et le développement des formations en santé à l’ère du numérique. Initiation à l’évaluation des trois savoirs en santé et au choix d’instruments de mesure. Intégration de l’utilisation des données probantes en enseignement en santé. Planification d’un atelier pédagogique pertinent à la pratique professionnelle en santé.  (préalable : EDU6531/MED6531)

Course Code: EDU 6533 Séminaire en enseignement en santé (3 crédits)
Course Description: Examen critique des thèmes reliés à l'enseignement en santé et inspirés de la recherche et des enjeux disciplinaires.

Course Code: EDU 6536 Introduction à la recherche en enseignement en santé (3 crédits)
Course Description: Initiation à la recherche en enseignement en santé. Élaboration d’une problématique et d’une recension d’écrits relative en enseignement en santé. Analyse de différentes approches de recherches appliquées.

Course Code: EDU 6537 Méthodologie de la recherche en enseignement en santé (3 crédits)
Course Description: Étude des approches, méthodes et étapes de la recherche en enseignement en santé. Examen de la complémentarité de divers types de recherche.

Course Code: EDU 6538 Stages en enseignement en santé (3 crédits)
Course Description: Insertion en tant que stagiaire dans un contexte professionnel. Analyse de pratiques et de thématiques actuelles en enseignement en santé. Rédaction d'un rapport de stage ciblant un thème lié au contexte d’enseignement en santé et intégrant les apprentissages sous forme de liens théorie-pratique.

Course Code: EDU 6546 Théories d'apprentissage appliquées à l'enseignement des langues secondes (3 crédits)
Course Description: Étude critique des théories d'apprentissage des langues secondes selon les perspectives linguistiques, cognitives et sociales.

Course Code: EDU 6571 Séminaire en développement professionnel et en planification de carrière (3 crédits)
Course Description: Approfondissement de certains aspects conceptuels du counselling et de la recherche appliquée au domaine du développement professionnel et de la planification de carrière.

Course Code: EDU 6573 Travail et santé mentale (3 crédits)
Course Description: Analyse des problèmes de santé mentale provoqués par le travail ou l'absence de travail : perte d'estime de soi, d'identité, de motivation, humiliation, culpabilité, épuisement professionnel, mise en chômage technique, etc. Nature et diagnostic. Mise en contexte de ces troubles dans divers courants de pensée. Étude des effets thérapeutiques du travail.

Course Code: EDU 6591 Recherche quantitative (3 crédits)
Course Description: Introduction à la planification, à l'analyse et à l'interprétation de la recherche quantitative selon les devis (méthodes) expérimentaux, quasi expérimentaux, observationnels et mixtes. (Ce cours de base s’adresse à des débutants en recherche quantitative)

Course Code: EDU 6593 Fondements en mesure et testing (3 crédits)
Course Description: Examen de la théorie classique des tests. Initiation aux concepts de fidélité et validité. Étude de notion d'échelle et des scores composites. Applications des notions précédentes dans le contexte d'une évaluation normative et d'une évaluation centrée sur un critère.

Course Code: EDU 6600 Formateurs d'adultes et contextes de formation (3 crédits)
Course Description: Étude des rôles et des fonctions des formateurs d'adultes.  Analyse des savoirs, des savoir-être et des savoir-faire des formateurs. Développement de programmes et contextes de formation.

Course Code: EDU 6604 Développement de l'adulte (3 crédits)
Course Description: Étude des théories du développement de l'adulte et de leur impact sur son apprentissage. Analyse des dimensions psychologiques, sociales et existentielles de la vie de l'adulte.

Course Code: EDU 6634 Gestion de la qualité en éducation (3 crédits)
Course Description: Analyse critique des principes, des méthodes et des techniques de gestion de la qualité totale appliquées à l'organisation scolaire.

Course Code: EDU 6637 Gestion et supervision des ressources professionnelles en éducation (3 crédits)
Course Description: Étude des modèles de gestion des ressources humaines dans les systèmes scolaires à partir de paramètres comme les conventions collectives, l'équité, la supervision, l'évaluation du rendement, le développement professionnel.

Course Code: EDU 6651 Éducation à la citoyenneté (3 crédits)
Course Description: Études des différentes approches théoriques et pratiques associées à la citoyenneté et leur lien avec les inégalités et la marginalisation sociales.

Course Code: EDU 6652 Littératie et diversité (3 crédits)
Course Description: Examen des divers concepts associé à la littératie et leurs rapports avec la construction de la personne en lien avec le langage et l'identité ethnique et sociale.

Course Code: EDU 6670 Counselling et orientation auprès des groupes minoritaires (3 crédits)
Course Description: Études des caractéristiques des groupes minoritaires tels que les femmes, les gais et les lesbiennes, les handicapés, les minorités linguistiques et/ou ethniques, etc., selon la perspective du counselling et de l'orientation de carrière.

Course Code: EDU 6671 Counselling et psychothérapie : Théories et pratiques II (3 crédits)
Course Description: Théories et techniques portant sur le développement des habiletés, des attitudes et des savoir-faire en counselling et psychothérapie.

Course Code: EDU 6672 Modèles et stratégies d'intervention en contexte de counselling scolaire (3 crédits)
Course Description: Différents modèles d'intervention associés au développement d'habiletés interpersonnelles et sociales des élèves. Stratégies de solution de problèmes, de gestion de classe, de résolution de conflits et de gestion du temps.

Course Code: EDU 6690 Méthodologie de la recherche (3 crédits)
Course Description: Examen des étapes de la recherche ainsi que des devis méthodologiques et des fondements épistémologiques.

Course Code: EDU 6693 Évaluation axée sur l'apprentissage (3 crédits)
Course Description: Étude de la nature et du rôle de l'évaluation formative des apprentissages scolaires. Sensibilisation aux conditions de mise en application dans le contexte de la salle de classe.

Course Code: EDU 6699 Évaluation des programmes : Théorie et problèmes actuels (3 crédits)
Course Description: Analyse critique des aspects théoriques et techniques des différentes approches en évaluation de programmes.

Course Code: EDU 6771 Thèmes choisis en psychologie du counselling (3 crédits)
Course Description: Étude approfondie d'un thème en psychologie du counselling.

Course Code: EDU 6775 Psychopathologie et évaluation (3 crédits)
Course Description: Analyse critique des particularités reliées au diagnostic et à l'évaluation des désordres psychologiques incluant : la pathogénie, la sémiologie, l'étiologie, la fréquence ainsi que les méthodes et les instruments pour l'évaluation clinique.

Course Code: EDU 6871 Stage en psychologie du counselling I (3 crédits)
Course Description: Stage clinique supervisé d'un minimum de 200 heures dans un centre offrant des services de counselling personnel et/ou de carrière.

Course Code: EDU 6872 Séminaire et practicum en counselling de groupe (3 crédits)
Course Description: Application des techniques de groupes à divers milieux : la communauté, les institutions et organisations, le milieu scolaire. Dynamique du comportement de groupes. Interactions psychologiques et sociales des groupes restreints.

Course Code: EDU 6873 Stage en psychologie du counselling II (3 crédits)
Course Description: Stage clinique supervisé d'un minimum de 200 heures dans un centre offrant des services de counselling personnel et/ou de carrière. Approfondissement de la pratique du counselling et de la psychothérapie.

Course Code: EDU 6874 Stage en psychologie du counselling III (3 crédits)
Course Description: Stage clinique supervisé d'un minimum de 200 heures dans un centre offrant des services de counselling personnel et/ou de carrière. Consolidation théorique et pratique des apprentissages et des stages en psychologie du counselling I et II. Utilisation systématique des principaux tests psychométriques requis par les associations et ordres professionnels.

Course Code: EDU 6999 Mémoire de recherche / Major Research Paper (6 crédits / 6 units)
Course Description: Production d'une recherche à petite échelle. Les activités y étant liées incluent la préparation de la proposition de recherche et l'analyse des données, la soumission du mémoire et la présentation orale de ce dernier. / Completion of a small-scale research project. Activities include preparation of a research proposal, analysis of data, submission of the major research paper, and an oral presentation of the research.

Course Code: EDU 7101 Selected Topics in Health Professions Education (3 units)
Course Description: Critical analysis of selected topics and their implications for health professions education.

Course Code: EDU 7141 Current Research in Second Language Education (3 units)
Course Description: Examination of current research in second language education representing diverse contemporary issues and conceptual frameworks.

Course Code: EDU 7151 Sociocultural Perspectives on Learning (3 units)
Course Description: Critical examination of theories of learning from sociocultural perspectives and their effects on educational practices.

Course Code: EDU 7163 Research Perspectives in Mathematics Education (3 units)
Course Description: Study of theoretical perspectives in mathematics education, examination of the connection between theory, research and practice in mathematics teaching and learning.

Course Code: EDU 7190 Qualitative Research (3 units)
Course Description: Critical study of qualitative methodologies (e.g., case study, ethnography, phenomenology, narrative inquiry, grounded theory) and approaches to research design.

Course Code: EDU 7210 Decision-making in Educational Organizations (3 units)
Course Description: Overview of key theories concerning decision-making and policy making at individual, organizational and system levels and application to educational decisions and policies.

Course Code: EDU 7214 Contemporary Topics in Environmental Education (3 units)
Course Description: Introduction to environmental education, an intellectually dynamic and rich field, by critically examining current conversations and tensions within it.

Course Code: EDU 7216 Decolonization and Anti-Colonialism in Education (3 units)
Course Description: Critical examination of theories, challenges and opportunities of decolonization in relation to educational and community contexts.

Course Code: EDU 7220 Mamatowisin (Mindfulness) in Scholarly Research (3 units)
Course Description: Critical examination of Indigenous research methodologies, protocols, and ethical dilemmas.

Course Code: EDU 7224 The Body, Movement and Affect in Education (3 units)
Course Description: Examination of literature that pertains to philosophies and theories of the body, movement and affect in curriculum and pedagogy

Course Code: EDU 7240 Feminist Perspectives in Education (3 units)
Course Description: Collaborative inquiry into the intersections of racialization, gender, sexualities, social class, able-bodiedness, ethnicity, and culture in education through a feminist lens.

Course Code: EDU 7242 Critical Disability Perspectives in Education (3 units)
Course Description: Critical analysis of research and practice related to the intersectionality and lived experiences of learners and educators with disabilities in historical and contemporary settings.

Course Code: EDU 7244 Queer Pedagogies (3 units)
Course Description: Critical examination of intersectional gender issues, including theories of representation, texts, identities, and their implications for questioning pedagogical practices in social institutions.

Course Code: EDU 7300 Selected topics (3 units)
Course Description: Indepth study of a current topic, developing field of inquiry or issue of importance in education.

Course Code: EDU 7380 Knowledge Syntheses in Education (3 units)
Course Description: Principles and techniques for gathering and synthesizing various sources of information in the form of scoping, systematic or other types of reviews.

Course Code: EDU 7395 Methods of Quantitative Analysis (3 units)
Course Description: Application and interpretation of quantitative analysis techniques (e.g., factor analysis, path analysis, meta-analysis and other selected techniques) in educational contexts. (Recommendation to have EDU 6191 or the equivalency).

Course Code: EDU 7396 Methods of Qualitative Analysis (3 units)
Course Description: Study of educational documents and approaches to textual research including historical criticism, discourse analysis and narrative theory.

Course Code: EDU 7397 Development and Evaluation of Data Collection Instruments (3 units)
Course Description: Study of the construction of data collection instruments and of the validation of interpretations of findings.

Course Code: EDU 7501 Thèmes choisis en enseignement aux professionnels de la santé (3 crédits)
Course Description: Études critiques de thèmes choisis et les implications dans l'éducation aux professionnels de la santé.

Course Code: EDU 7533 Thèmes choisis en sociétés, cultures et langues (3 crédits)
Course Description: Étude approfondie d'un thème en sociétés, cultures et langues.

Course Code: EDU 7541 Enjeux actuels de la recherche en didactique des langues secondes (3 crédits)
Course Description: Analyse de la recherche en didactique des langues secondes fondée sur des questions propres au contexte éducatif et des cadres conceptuels divers.

Course Code: EDU 7563 Perspectives de recherche en éducation mathématique (3 crédits)
Course Description: Étude des différentes perspectives de recherche en didactique des mathématiques. Examen des implications pour l'enseignement et l'apprentissage.

Course Code: EDU 7590 Méthodes d'analyse qualitative (3 crédits)
Course Description: Étude de diverses approches qualitatives d'analyse de données. Utilisation de différents logiciels. Interprétation et mise en application des résultats.  (Il est recommandé d’avoir réussi le cours EDU7590 ou un cours équivalent)

Course Code: EDU 7696 Méthodes d'analyse qualitative (3 crédits)
Course Description: Étude de diverses approches qualitatives d'analyse de données. Utilisation de différents logiciels. Interprétation et mise en application des résultats.

Course Code: EDU 7700 Sujet d'actualité (3 crédits)
Course Description: Étude approfondie d’un sujet d’actualité, d’un domaine de recherche en développement ou d’une question d'importance en éducation.

Course Code: EDU 7795 Méthodes d’analyse quantitative (3 crédits)
Course Description: Planification et analyse de la recherche quantitative : application d’analyses statistiques avancées, y compris l’analyse factorielle, l’analyse de chemin, la méta-analyse et d’autres techniques sélectionnées.  Interprétation et mise en application des résultats. (Il est recommandé d’avoir réussi le cours EDU6591 ou un cours équivalent)

Course Code: EDU 7797 Développement et évaluation des instruments de collecte de données (3 crédits)
Course Description: Étude et mise en application des méthodes de construction et de validation d'outils de collecte de données en recherche qualitative, quantitative et mixte.

Course Code: EDU 8105 Contemporary Issues in Education (3 units)
Course Description: Examination of current issues in education from multiple research traditions; exploration of students'  prospective PhD projects in relation to major trends in educational research. (Reserved for PhD students.)

Course Code: EDU 8106 Epistemology and Research (3 units)
Course Description: Critical study of epistemological foundations of research; implications for ethics and epistemological assumptions underlying diverse research designs. Application of research skills. (Reserved for PhD students.)

Course Code: EDU 8107 Seminar in Counselling and Supervision (3 units)
Course Description: Examination and critique of current scholarship from multiple research traditions in counselling and supervision; implications for counselling and supervisory practice.

Course Code: EDU 8190 Perspectives and Paradigms in Qualitative Research (3 units)
Course Description: Critical examination of methodological, organizational, ethical, and political issues within qualitative research. (Recommendation to have EDU 7190 or the equivalency)

Course Code: EDU 8253 Cognitive, Embodies and Ecological Perspectives on Learning (3 units)
Course Description: Examination of neuroplasticity, the bodily basis of cognition, and dynamic interactions to understand the biological-cultural nature of learning.

Course Code: EDU 8505 Questions contemporaines en éducation (3 crédits)
Course Description: Examen critique des questions contemporaines et interdisciplinaires en éducation selon diverses traditions  de recherche. Critique des avant-projets doctoraux en fonction des tendances en recherche éducationnelle.  (Réservé aux étudiants de doctorat.)

Course Code: EDU 8506 Épistémologie et recherche (3 crédits)
Course Description: Étude de l’épistémologie comme rapport au savoir et des principaux paradigmes de la recherche. Distinction de leurs fondements et des manières de les mettre en application (Réservé aux étudiantes et étudiants du Ph.D.)

Course Code: EDU 8507 Séminaire en counselling et supervision (3 crédits)
Course Description: Étude critique des approches théoriques en counselling et supervision; implications pour les pratiques de counselling et de supervision.

Course Code: EDU 8590 Recherche qualitative II (3 crédits)
Course Description: Examen des questions méthodologiques, organisationnelles, déontologiques et politiques reliées à la recherche qualitative.

Course Code: EDU 8653 Séminaire sur les processus cognitifs dans divers contextes éducatifs (3 crédits)
Course Description: Analyse de processus cognitifs essentiels à partir de diverses perspectives théoriques; mise en application de théories d'apprentissage dans divers contextes.

Course Code: EDU 8908 Internat en counselling et en supervision / Internship in Counselling and Supervision
Course Description: Internat de 600 heures en counselling et en supervision dans un centre approuvé par la direction du programme; développement des compétences en supervision et application des normes éthiques relatives à la pratique et à la supervision en counselling. Noté S (satisfaisant) ou NS (non satisfaisant). / Internship of 600 hours of counselling and counsellor supervision in approved settings; development of advanced counselling and supervisory competence; application of ethical principles to counselling and supervisory practice. Graded S (Satisfactory) / NS (Not satisfactory).

Course Code: PED 1140 Education in the Primary/Junior Division Language (3 units)
Course Description: A study of language instruction at the primary/junior division; intended to provide educators new to the teaching of language arts with both a practical and theoretical foundation for future study and action in this important area.  Special emphasis to the essentials of instructional planning and implementation, from awareness of how children learn to use language to knowledge of different teaching approaches.

Course Code: PED 1142 Professional Inquiry in Practice - ITEP Part I (3 units)
Course Description: Examination of the Standards of Practice of the Ontario College of Teachers, and of the moral and professional ethics of teaching; preparation for, and ongoing monitoring of, practice teaching; personal and collaborative exploration of the development of self as teacher; community service learning.

Course Code: PED 11421 Professional Inquiry in Practice - ITEP Part I (1 of 2)
Course Description: Examination of the Standards of Practice of the Ontario College of Teachers, and of the moral and professional ethics of teaching; preparation for, and ongoing monitoring of, practice teaching; personal and collaborative exploration of the development of self as teacher; community service learning. (1 of 2)

Course Code: PED 11422 Professional Inquiry in Practice - ITEP Part I (2 of 2) (3 units)
Course Description: Examination of the Standards of Practice of the Ontario College of Teachers, and of the moral and professional ethics of teaching; preparation for, and ongoing monitoring of, practice teaching; personal and collaborative exploration of the development of self as teacher; community service learning. (2 of 2)

Course Code: PED 1143 Professional Inquiry in Practice - ITEP Part 2 (3 units)
Course Description: Examination of issues in Indigenous education; preparation for, and ongoing monitoring of, practice teaching; personal and collaborative inquiry into classroom practice; community service learning.

Course Code: PED 11431 Professional Inquiry in Practice - ITEP Part II (1 of 2)
Course Description: Examination of issues in Indigenous education; preparation for, and ongoing monitoring of, practice teaching; personal and collaborative inquiry into classroom practice; community service learning. (1 of 2)

Course Code: PED 11432 Professional Inquiry in Practice - ITEP Part II (2 of 2) (3 units)
Course Description: Examination of issues in Indigenous education; preparation for, and ongoing monitoring of, practice teaching; personal and collaborative inquiry into classroom practice; community service learning. (2 of 2)

Course Code: PED 1144 Professional Inquiry in Practice - ITEP Part 3 (3 units)
Course Description: Examination of what it means to be an Indigenous teacher; preparation for, and ongoing monitoring of, practice teaching; personal and collaborative inquiry into classrom practice; action research; community service learning.

Course Code: PED 11441 Professional Inquiry in Practice - ITEP Part III (1 of 2)
Course Description: Examination of what it means to be an Indigenous teacher; preparation for, and ongoing monitoring of, practice teaching; personal and collaborative inquiry into classroom practice; action research; community service learning. (1 of 2)

Course Code: PED 11442 Professional Inquiry in Practice - ITEP Part III (2 of 2) (3 units)
Course Description: Examination of what it means to be an Indigenous teacher; preparation for, and ongoing monitoring of, practice teaching; personal and collaborative inquiry into classroom practice; action research; community service learning. (2 of 2)

Course Code: PED 1146 Education in the Primary and Junior Division - Indigenous Languages (3 units)
Course Description: Examination of Ministry documents on Indigenous languages: models of Indigenous language education; curriculum design; instructional strategies and assessment; issues and problems related to teaching Indigenous languages.

Course Code: PED 1147 Practicum in the Primary and Junior Division (1.5 unit)
Course Description: Observation, reflection, and practice teaching in the primary/junior division classrooms as identified by the regulations of the Ontario Ministry of Education and the Ontario College of Teachers; associate teacher provides mentoring and feedback as well as formative and summative evaluations of teacher candidates.

Course Code: PED 1148 Education in the Primary and Junior Division - Health and Physical Education (3 units)
Course Description: Analysis of the Ontario Curriculum, policies and resources; principles of curriculum design and assessment; examination of issues related to healthy living and the role of schools; First Nations, Métis, and Inuit perspectives; inclusive education.

Course Code: PED 1149 Education in the Primary/Junior Division - Social Studies (3 units)
Course Description: Principles of curriculum design and assessment; analysis of First Nations, Métis, and Inuit perspectives, the Ontario Curriculum and other support documents; identification of specific skills such as historical conscientiousness and critical thinking; analysis of representative learning experiences in Social Studies; preparation and utilization of resources material and integration of digital technologies into lessons.

Course Code: PED 1158 Education in the Primary/Junior Mathematics (3 units)
Course Description: Principles of curriculum design and evaluation refined and applied to the Primary/Junior division level to mathematics; analyses or the Ontario curriculum and other ministry support documents; identification of specific skills and representative learning experiences in mathematics; preparation and utilization of resource materials.

Course Code: PED 1159 Education in the Primary/Junior Science and Technology (3 units)
Course Description: Principles of curriculum design and evaluation refined and applied to the primary/junior division level to Science and Technology; analysis of the Ontario Curriculum and other ministry support documents; identification of specific skills and representative learning experiences in Science and Technology; preparation and utilization of resource materials

Course Code: PED 1500 Stage I en milieu scolaire et séminaire d'intégration (3 crédits)
Course Description: Observation en classe et prise en charge progressive d'activités d'enseignement.  Repérage des composantes d'une pratique professionnelle d'enseignement.  Réflexion critique sur les gestes professionnels et séminaires d'intégration entre les théories et les pratiques en classe.  Élaboration d'un dossier professionnel d'apprentissage.

Course Code: PED 1501 Introduction à l'enseignement (3 crédits)
Course Description: Ce cours a pour but d'initier l'étudiant.e aux rudiments de la profession enseignante. Ce cours permettra à l'étudiant.e de mieux saisir le lien étroit qui existe entre l'apprenant, le savoir et l'enseignant : la relation pédagogique. Plus spécifiquement, à travers ce cours, l'étudiant.e pourra en apprendre davantage sur le système scolaire franco- ontarien, sur l'organisation et la structure des différents conseils scolaires, sur l'éducation en langue française en contexte minoritaire, sur l'art et la science d'enseigner. Ce cours exclusivement en ligne est structuré de sorte que chaque étudiant.e se trouve au centre de ses apprentissages. Ainsi, celui-ci est organisé de façon à permettre la construction des connaissances et d'approfondir les notions fondamentales en éducation à partir des discussions de groupe, des lectures, des ateliers collaboratifs et des travaux pratiques proposés en classe.

Course Code: PED 1599 Connaissances et habilités reliées au français écrit en enseignement (3 crédits)
Course Description: Rédaction de textes:  diversité de genres, destinataires et intentions. Consolidation d'habiletés:  révision et correction des textes rédigés. Approfondissement de connaissances; composantes linguistique, discursive et pragmatique de la langue écrite.

Course Code: PED 15991 Connaissances et habilités reliées au français écrit en enseignement (Partie 1 de 2)
Course Description: Rédaction de textes:  diversité de genres, destinataires et intentions. Consolidation d'habiletés:  révision et correction des textes rédigés. Approfondissement de connaissances; composantes linguistique, discursive et pragmatique de la langue écrite. (Partie 1 de 2)

Course Code: PED 15992 Connaissances et habilités reliées au français écrit en enseignement (Partie 2 de 2) (3 crédits)
Course Description: Rédaction de textes:  diversité de genres, destinataires et intentions. Consolidation d'habiletés:  révision et correction des textes rédigés. Approfondissement de connaissances; composantes linguistique, discursive et pragmatique de la langue écrite. (Partie 2 de 2)

Course Code: PED 1609 Examen de synthèse : Éducation technologique
Course Description: Examen de synthèse en enseignement de l'éducation technologique aux cycles intermédiaire et supérieur. (9e-12e).

Course Code: PED 1788 Enseignement du FLS aux cycles primaire et moyen I (3 crédits)
Course Description: Initiation à l'enseignement d'une ou de plusieurs disciplines aux cycles primaire et moyen selon les stages de croissance et du développement de l'élève. Contribution de la matière à ce stade de développement, cadre théorique de l'apprentissage de cette discipline et implications pédagogiques; étude critique et interprétation des exigences des programmes à divers niveaux de difficultés; travaux d'analyse et d'application de stratégies d'enseignement, de méthodologies et de techniques propres à l'enseignement de la matière en question; préparation et utilisation du matériel didactique particulier à la matière; mise en situation. Mesure et évaluation de l'élève. Problème particulier : satisfaction des besoins individuels.

Course Code: PED 2130 Practicum I in the Primary/Junior Division - ITEP (3 units)
Course Description: Observation, reflection, and practice teaching in the primary/junior division classrooms as identified by the regulations of the Ontario Ministry of Education and the Ontario College of Teachers; associate teachers provides mentoring and feedback as well as formative and summative evaluations of teacher candidates.

Course Code: PED 2140 Education in the Primary and Junior Division Arts (3 units)
Course Description: Principles of curriculum design and evaluation applied to the Arts (dance, drama, music, visual arts) in the primary/junior division; analysis of the mandated Ontario Curriculum and other Ministry support documents; applications of appropriate learning experiences to meet the needs of young children; identification of skills specifically related to personal creativity and expressiveness; preparation and utilization of teaching strategies, resources and assessment instruments appropriate for arts instruction in an outcome-based setting.

Course Code: PED 2141 Education in the Junior Intermediate Division Social Studies (History and Geo.) and Health and phy. (3 units)
Course Description: Principles of curriculum design and evaluation as applied at the junior and intermediate division levels; analysis of the Ontario Curriculum and other Ministry documents; identification of specific skills and representative learning experiences in Social Studies, Health and Physical Education; preparation and utilization of resource materials.

Course Code: PED 2143 Professional Inquiry in Practice (3 units)
Course Description: Inquiry into teaching as a professional practice.   Examination of the Standards of Practice of the Ontario College of Teachers, and of the moral and professional ethics of teaching. Preparation for, and ongoing monitoring of, practice teaching. Personal exploration of the development of self as teacher. (S/NS)

Course Code: PED 21431 Professional Inquiry in Practice (Part 1 of 2)
Course Description: Inquiry into teaching as a professional practice.   Examination of the Standards of Practice of the Ontario College of Teachers, and of the moral and professional ethics of teaching. Preparation for, and ongoing monitoring of, practice teaching. Personal exploration of the development of self as teacher. (S/NS) (Part 1 of 2)

Course Code: PED 21432 Professional Inquiry in Practice (Part 2 of 2) (3 units)
Course Description: Inquiry into teaching as a professional practice.   Examination of the Standards of Practice of the Ontario College of Teachers, and of the moral and professional ethics of teaching. Preparation for, and ongoing monitoring of, practice teaching. Personal exploration of the development of self as teacher. (S/NS) (Part 2 of 2)

Course Code: PED 2146 Practicum in the Junior (1.5 unit)
Course Description: Observation, reflection, and practice teaching in the junior/intermediate division classrooms as identified by the regulations of the Ontario Ministry of Education and the Ontario College of Teachers; associate teacher provides mentoring and feedback as well as formative and summative evaluations of teacher candidates.

Course Code: PED 2147 Practicum in the Primary (1.5 unit)
Course Description: Observation, reflection, and practice teaching in the primary/junior division classrooms as identified by the regulations of the Ontario Ministry of Education and the Ontario College of Teachers; associate teacher provides mentoring and feedback as well as formative and summative evaluations of teacher candidates.

Course Code: PED 2500 Stage II en milieu scolaire et séminaire d'intégration (3 crédits)
Course Description: Observation en classe et prise en charge progressive d'activités d'enseignement.  Repérage des composantes d'une pratique professionnelle d'enseignement.  Réflexion critique sur les gestes professionels et séminaires d'intégration entre les théories et les pratiques en classe.  Élaboration d'un dossier professionel d'apprentissage.

Course Code: PED 2507 Réalités scolaires actuelles (3 crédits)
Course Description: Initiation aux grandes problématiques confrontant l'enseignante et l'enseignant d'aujourd'hui.  Étude de situations reflétant la réalité scolaire et faisant référence à des questions d'éthique, d'équité, de sexualité, de violence, de sexisme, etc.  Introduction à des modèles de résolution de conflits et de gestion des différences.  (Cours offert aux étudiantes et étudiants de premier cycle).

Course Code: PED 2508 La relation pédagogique (3 crédits)
Course Description: Initiation à diverses conceptions portant sur l'enseignement et l'apprentissage.  Analyse du triangle apprenant, enseignant et savoir. Transmission et intégration du savoir.  Exploration des principes pédagogiques.  (Cours offert aux étudiantes et étudiants de premier cycle).

Course Code: PED 2727 Problématique de l'enseignement des mathématiques (3 crédits)
Course Description: Étude de la genèse historique et épistémologique des concepts mathématiques de base.  Examen des approches contemporaines en enseignement des mathématiques.  Analyse des principales problématiques.

Course Code: PED 2728 Problématique de l'enseignement des sciences (3 crédits)
Course Description: Concepts de base (épistémologie, didactique, stratégies d'enseignement) et historique du développement de l'enseignement des sciences. Approches contemporaines à l'enseignement des sciences.  Identification et analyse des principales problématiques.

Course Code: PED 2788 Enseignement du français langue seconde aux cycles primaire et moyen - II (3 crédits)
Course Description: Initiation à l'enseignement d'une ou de plusieurs disciplines aux cycles primaire et moyen selon les stages de croissance et du développement de l'élève. Contribution de la matière à ce stade de développement, cadre théorique de l'apprentissage de cette discipline et implications pédagogiques; étude critique et interprétation des exigences des programmes à divers niveaux de difficultés; travaux d'analyse et d'application de stratégies d'enseignement, de méthodologies et de techniques propres à l'enseignement de la matière en question; préparation et utilisation du matériel didactique particulier à la matière; mise en situation. Mesure et évaluation de l'élève.  Problème particulier : satisfaction des besoins individuels.

Course Code: PED 2789 Enseignement du français langue seconde aux cycles moyen et intermédiaire - I (3 crédits)
Course Description: Initiation à l'enseignement d'une ou de plusieurs disciplines aux cycles moyen et intermédiaire selon les stages de croissance et du développement de l'élève. Contribution de la matière à ce stade de développement, cadre théorique de l'apprentissage de cette discipline et implications pédagogiques; étude critique et interprétation des exigences des programmes à divers niveaux de difficultés; travaux d'analyse et d'application de stratégies d'enseignement, de méthodologies et de techniques propres à l'enseignement de la matière en question; préparation et utilisation du matériel didactique particulier à la matière; mise en situation. Mesure et évaluation de l'élève.  Problème particulier : satisfaction des besoins individuels.

Course Code: PED 3101 The Learning Process in Education Setting (3 units)
Course Description: Examination of major theoretical principles upon which education for children and adults may be based; identification of normative characteristics of learners; current trends in the application of theory to classroom situations.

Course Code: PED 3102 Schooling and Society (3 units)
Course Description: The application of the educational foundation disciplines to the study of schooling and its social contexts; the roles of teachers in reproducing and challenging social inequalities; personal exploration of the social influences on identity.

Course Code: PED 3103 Curriculum Design and Evaluation in Education (3 units)
Course Description: Overview of major curriculum theorists; examination of the Ontario Curriculum and other curriculum documents; development of lessons and units based on the Ontario Curriculum; an overview of the theory, issues and strategies for assessment of pupils.  Competence in the use of technology must be demonstrated.

Course Code: PED 3106 Education of Exceptional Students (3 units)
Course Description: An overview of various exceptionalities:  learning disabilities, behavioural disorders, gifted, developmentally delayed, hearing impairment, physical disabilities, language delay and disorders; issues related to special education; emphasis is on strategies to assist teachers in addressing the special education needs of pupils in the regular classroom.

Course Code: PED 3107 Using Technology in Teaching in an Indigenous Context (3 units)
Course Description: The role of educational technology in teaching in an Indigenous context.  Examination of equipment and educational software and their use in the classroom.  Particular attention to the use of computers and their role in supporting teaching.  Evaluation of educational software. Students will be required to become familiar with the equipment in the lab and to do practical exercices.

Course Code: PED 3108 Teaching English as a Second Language to Indigenous Students (3 units)
Course Description: Examination of the rationale for teaching English as a second language (ESL) in an Indigenous context; models of ESL education; curriculum design, teaching strategies and assessment; issues and problems related to teaching English as a second language in Indigenous schools.

Course Code: PED 3110 Teaching in Roman Catholic Separate Schools (3 units)
Course Description: Introduction to religious education in catholic schools in Ontario. Impact on the whole learner; theoretical framework and pedagogical implications; relevant curriculum guidelines, programs of studies, resources and teaching strategies. Evaluation procedures and techniques.

Course Code: PED 3111 Teaching at the Primary Division: Part I (3 units)
Course Description: Examination of instructional design and assessment strategies, models of inquiry and critical thinking, and approaches to curriculum integration relevant to the primary division (kindergarten to grade 3); special focus on Mathematics and the Arts Ontario Curriculum and other pedagogical resources.

Course Code: PED 3112 Teaching at the Primary Division: Part II (3 units)
Course Description: Examination of instructional design and assessment strategies, models of inquiry and critical thinking, and approaches to curriculum integration relevant to the primary division (kindergarten to grade 3); special focus on Language Arts and Social Studies Ontario Curriculum and other pegagogical resources.

Course Code: PED 3113 Teaching at the Primary Division: Part III (3 units)
Course Description: Examination of instructional design and assessment strategies, models of inquiry and critical thinking, and approaches to curriculum integration relevant to the primary division (kindergarten to grade 3); special focus on Physical and Health Education and Science Ontario Curriculum and other pedagogical resources.

Course Code: PED 3114 Teaching at the Junior Division: Part I (3 units)
Course Description: Examination of instructional and assessment strategies, models of inquiry and critical thinking, and approaches to curriculum integration relevant to the junior division (grade 4 to grade 6); special focus on the Arts and Language Arts Ontario Curriculum and other pedagogical resources.

Course Code: PED 3119 Integrating Technology in the Classroom (3 units)
Course Description: Examination of the roles and applications of Information and Communications Technologies in the teaching and learning process; integration of current theories and available tools.

Course Code: PED 3120 Teaching at the Junior Division: Part II (3 units)
Course Description: Examination of instructional and assessment strategies, models of inquiry and critical thinking, and approaches to curriculum integration relevant to the junior division (grade 4 to grade 6); special focus on Social Studies and Physical and Health Education Ontario Curriculum and other pedagogical resources.

Course Code: PED 3121 Teaching at the Junior Division: Part III (3 units)
Course Description: Examination of instructional and assessment strategies, models of inquiry and critical thinking, and approaches to curriculum integration relevant to the junior division (grade 4 to grade 6); special focus on Science and Mathematics Ontario Curriculum and other pedagogical resources.

Course Code: PED 3122 Teaching Indigenous Languages in an Immersion Setting (3 units)
Course Description: Examination of the rationale for immersion education in an Indigenous context: models of immersion education; curriculum design; teaching strategies and assessment; issues and problems related to teaching immersion in Indigenous schools.

Course Code: PED 3123 Political and Professional Organization in Indigenous Education (3 units)
Course Description: Examination of political and professional organization in Indigenous education at the community, provincial and national levels.

Course Code: PED 3124 Equity in Education: Theory and Practice (3 units)
Course Description: Examination of the theories and practices of educational equity in relation to sexism, racism, and other social inequalities; development of student's equity practices.

Course Code: PED 3129 Second Language Perspectives in Education (3 units)
Course Description: Current theoretical perspectives on second language teaching and learning and their relation to educational practice; examination of the relationship between second language acquisition and identity construction; exploration of multiple literacies in second language contexts.

Course Code: PED 3130 Practicum II in the Primary/Junior Division - ITEP (3 units)
Course Description: Observation, reflection and practice teaching in the primary/junior division classrooms as identified by the regulations of the Ontario Ministry of Education and the Ontario College of Teachers; associate teacher provides mentoring and feedback as well as formative and summative evaluations of teacher candidates.

Course Code: PED 3131 General Science at the Intermediate Level (3 units)
Course Description: Examination of the core content areas of the intermediate science curriculum including chemistry, physics, biology, earth and space, matter and materials, life systems and energy; study of the issues behind teaching science in these multiple content areas

Course Code: PED 3132 Approaches to the Teaching of Science at the Intermediate Level (3 units)
Course Description: Examination of the issues and challenges of teaching science including the epistemological assumptions underpinning science education; study of pedagogical practice and theory in the development of science knowledge among diverse learners

Course Code: PED 3133 Counselling Applications in Secondary Schools (3 units)
Course Description: Theory and practice of one-on-one and group conversational dynamics; examination of developmental features of adolescence and issues related to diversity,  high-risk behaviour,  trauma and crisis; Addressed to secondary teachers who combine instructional responsibilities with a supportive role in school guidance and counselling activities

Course Code: PED 3134 Social Justice and Global Education (3 units)
Course Description: Explores the research and classroom practice of themes within International Development including health and nutrition, basic education, HIV/AIDS, child protection, gender equality, infrastructure services, human rights, democracy and good governance, private sector development, and environment; considers the implications of integrating these themes into the mainstream curriculum

Course Code: PED 3136 Holistic and Non-Traditional Approaches to Education (3 units)
Course Description: Exploration of theories and practices associated with interconnectedness within school experiences; examines models of curriculum design and teaching that respect holistic learning and multi-disciplinary approaches; promotion of self-directed and experiential learning including alternative settings.

Course Code: PED 3138 First Nations, Inuit and Métis Education: Historical Experiences and Contemporary Perspectives (3 units)
Course Description: Examination of the historical experiences and contemporary perspectives on education of First Nations, Inuit and Métis people, from their own points of view, including traditional approaches to education, experiences in government-controlled and residential schools, and the problems and possibilities of self-government in education. Exploration of First Nations, Inuit and Métis perspectives on the role of education in language preservation, cultural renewal and the achievement of self-government.

Course Code: PED 3139 Creating Healthy, Safe and Supportive Learning Environments (3 units)
Course Description: Exploration of theories and practices associated with approaches that foster positive behavior and build community; examines values and principles of different approaches and their application to individual students, classrooms, schools and the community in an effort to create healthy, safe and supportive learning environments.

Course Code: PED 3140 Education in the Junior (3 units)
Course Description: Principles of curriculum design and evaluation; analysis of the mandated Ontario Curriculum and other Ministry documents; applications of appropriate learning experiences to meet the needs of young children; identification of skills specifically related to personal creativity and expressiveness; preparation and utilization of teaching strategies, resources and assessment instruments appropriate for arts instruction in an outcome based setting.

Course Code: PED 3141 Curriculum Planning, Implementation and Assessment Part I (3 units)
Course Description: Introduction to the theory, issues and strategies for designing instruction and assessing student learning; examination of the Ontario Curriculum and other curriculum documents, development of lessons and units based on the Ontario Curriculum.

Course Code: PED 3142 Learning Theories and Practices in Inclusive Classrooms Part I (3 units)
Course Description: Examination of major theoretical principles upon which education for children and adolescents may be based; an overview of differentiated instruction; emphasis on strategies to assist teachers in addressing learning in diverse and inclusive classrooms.

Course Code: PED 3143 Practicum in the Intermediate Senior Division I (1.5 unit)
Course Description: Observation, reflection, and practice teaching in the intermediate/senior division classrooms as identified by the regulations of the Ontario Ministry of Education and the Ontario College of Teachers; associate teacher provides mentoring and feedback as well as formative and summative evaluations of teacher candidates.

Course Code: PED 3144 Counselling Applications in Elementary School Contexts (3 units)
Course Description: Examination of the interpersonal processes and relationship dynamics in school contexts within a pluralistic society; development of verbal and non-verbal skills for facilitating communication and promoting respectful interactions; pro-social strategies for effective conflict resolution.

Course Code: PED 3145 Kindergarten and the Early Years (3 units)
Course Description: Examination of theoretical understanding, practical applications and resources appropriate for the Junior kindergarten/Senior kindergarten classroom; topics will include developmentally appropriate practices, theories of play, the current Ontario curriculum, assessment and evaluation, and emergent/early literacy and numeracy.

Course Code: PED 3146 Practicum in the Junior/Intermediate Division (1.5 unit)
Course Description: Observation, reflection, and practice teaching in the junior/intermediate division classrooms as identified by the regulations of the Ontario Ministry of Education and the Ontario College of Teachers; associate teacher provides mentoring and feedback as well as formative and summative evaluations of teacher candidates.

Course Code: PED 3148 Teaching Writing Across the Curriculum (3 units)
Course Description: Exploration of theories and practices associated with the teaching of writing across the curriculum. Issues in writing assessment.

Course Code: PED 3150 Becoming a Teacher Through Inquiry in Practice (3 units)
Course Description: Engagement in personal and collaborative reflection and enactment of the Ontario College of Teachers "Standards of Practice and Ethical Standards for the Teaching Profession"; preparation for, and ongoing monitoring of, practice teaching; synthesis of personal professional development of self as teacher through action research and inquiry.

Course Code: PED 31501 Becoming a Teacher Through Inquiry in Practice (Part 1 of 2)
Course Description: Engagement in personal and collaborative reflection and enactment of the Ontario College of Teachers "Standards of Practice and Ethical Standards for the Teaching Profession"; preparation for, and ongoing monitoring of, practice teaching; synthesis of personal professional development of self as teacher through action research and inquiry. (Part 1 of 2)

Course Code: PED 31502 Becoming a Teacher Through Inquiry in Practice (Part 2 of 2) (3 units)
Course Description: Engagement in personal and collaborative reflection and enactment of the Ontario College of Teachers "Standards of Practice and Ethical Standards for the Teaching Profession"; preparation for, and ongoing monitoring of, practice teaching; synthesis of personal professional development of self as teacher through action research and inquiry. (Part 2 of 2)

Course Code: PED 3151 Enacting Collaborative Inquiry in Professional Practice (3 units)
Course Description: Collaborative inquiry into and enactment of teaching practice through professional learning communities; preparation for, and ongoing monitoring of, practice teaching drawing on models from fields of action research, innovation, creativity, and critical thinking; synthesis of personal professional development of self as teacher.

Course Code: PED 31511 Enacting Collaborative Inquiry in Professional Practice (Part 1 of 2)
Course Description: Collaborative inquiry into and enactment of teaching practice through professional learning communities; preparation for, and ongoing monitoring of, practice teaching drawing on models from fields of action research, innovation, creativity, and critical thinking; synthesis of personal professional development of self as teacher. (Part 1 of 2)

Course Code: PED 31512 Enacting Collaborative Inquiry in Professional Practice (Part 2 of 2) (3 units)
Course Description: Collaborative inquiry into and enactment of teaching practice through professional learning communities; preparation for, and ongoing monitoring of, practice teaching drawing on models from fields of action research, innovation, creativity, and critical thinking; synthesis of personal professional development of self as teacher. (Part 2 of 2)

Course Code: PED 3152 Enhancing Mathematics and Science Thinking (3 units)
Course Description: Focus on deepening understanding of fundamental mathematics and science concepts relevant for teaching and learning at the elementary school level.

Course Code: PED 3153 The Context of Ontario Middle and Secondary Schools (3 units)
Course Description: Examination of the structures, programs and opportunities available to intermediate and senior students; consideration of climates to support adolescent well-being.

Course Code: PED 3154 Teaching at the Intermediate Division (3 units)
Course Description: Examination of instructional and assessment strategies, models of inquiry and critical thinking, strategies for transitions and approaches to curriculum integration relevant to the intermediate division (grade 7 to grade 10); examination of relevant Ontario Curriculum and other resources; examination of current Ministry initiatives and policies.

Course Code: PED 3155 Teaching Across the Intermediate Senior Curriculum (3 units)
Course Description: Integration of theory and practice of teaching at the middle and secondary school levels; examination of the range of subject taught at these levels in the Ontario Curriculum.

Course Code: PED 3158 Education in the Junior and Intermediate Division Mathematics (3 units)
Course Description: Principles of curriculum design and evaluation as applied at the junior and intermediate division levels; analysis of the Ontario Curriculum and other Ministry documents; identification of specific skills and representative learning experiences in Mathematics; preparation and utilization of resource materials

Course Code: PED 3159 Education in the Junior and Intermediate Division - Science and Technology (3 units)
Course Description: Principles of curriculum design and evaluation as applied at the junior and intermediate division levels; analysis of the Ontario Curriculum and other Ministry documents; identification of specific skills and representative learning experiences in Science and Technology; preparation and utilization of resource materials

Course Code: PED 3160 Introduction to Educational Leadership (3 units)
Course Description: Examination of the dynamics and processes of K-12 school administration and leadership; exploration of dilemmas and challenges confronting school leaders in real settings, including approaches used to navigate complex situations; connects theory, research and practice in educational leadership.

Course Code: PED 3161 Exploring Gender & Sexual Diversity through a Critical Lens (3 units)
Course Description: Examination of critical theories related to gender and sexuality, including language and curriculum; critical analysis of current practices in sexual health education; consideration of how gender and sexual diversity intersect with class and race, as well as the lived experience of the formation of identities, and how this may impact student and teacher growth and learning.

Course Code: PED 3162 Connecting Math to your World (3 units)
Course Description: Designed for Intermediate/Senior teacher candidates who do not have math as a teachable; Engagement with fundamental math concepts in ways intended to enhance confidence and support the rewriting of one’s own math story; focus on challenging established views of mathematics, building on one’s natural curiosity and developing mathematical agency.

Course Code: PED 3166 Language and Literacy in the Elementary Schools: Development and Practice (3 units)
Course Description: Examination of the theories, research, and practices of  literacy learning and teaching. Introduction to language development, science of reading, structured literacy, early years interventions, and language arts pedagogy, resources, and assessment.

Course Code: PED 3174 Teaching Computer Studies at the Intermediate Division (3 units)
Course Description: Introduction to the teaching of one of many disciplines at the intermediate and senior divisions.  Impact of the particular discipline on the whole learner; individualized instruction; theoretical framework and pedagogical implications; critical examination and interpretation of relevant curriculum guidelines.  Development of programs; analysis and application of specific teaching strategies and techniques unique to the discipline.  Evaluation procedures and techniques.

Course Code: PED 3175 Teaching Drama at the Intermediate Division (3 units)
Course Description: Introduction to the teaching of one of many disciplines at the intermediate and senior divisions.  Impact of the particular discipline on the whole learner; individualized instruction; theoretical framework and pedagogical implications; critical examination and interpretation of relevant curriculum guidelines.  Development of programs; analysis and application of specific teaching strategies and techniques unique to the discipline.  Evaluation procedures and techniques.

Course Code: PED 3177 Teaching English at the Intermediate Division (3 units)
Course Description: Introduction to the teaching of one of many disciplines at the intermediate and senior divisions.  Impact of the particular discipline on the whole learner; individualized instruction; theoretical framework and pedagogical implications; critical examination and interpretation of relevant curriculum guidelines.  Development of programs; analysis and application of specific teaching strategies and techniques unique to the discipline.  Evaluation procedures and techniques.

Course Code: PED 3182 Teaching Geography at the Intermediate Division (3 units)
Course Description: Introduction to the teaching of one of many disciplines at the intermediate and senior divisions.  Impact of the particular discipline on the whole learner; individualized instruction; theoretical framework and pedagogical implications; critical examination and interpretation of relevant curriculum guidelines.  Development of programs; analysis and application of specific teaching strategies and techniques unique to the discipline.  Evaluation procedures and techniques.

Impact of the particular discipline on the whole learner; individualized instruction; theoretical framework and pedagogical implications; critical examination and interpretation of relevant curriculum guidelines.  Development of programs; analysis and application of specific teaching strategies and techniques unique to the discipline.  Evaluation procedures and techniques.

Course Description: Introduction to the teaching of one of many disciplines at the intermediate and senior divisions.  Impact of the particular discipline on the whole learner; individualized instruction; theoretical framework and pedagogical implications; critical examination and interpretation of relevant curriculum guidelines.  Development of programs; analysis and application of specific teaching strategies and techniques unique to the discipline.  Evaluation procedures and techniques.

Course Description: Introduction to the teaching of one of many disciplines at the intermediate and senior divisions.  Impact of the particular discipline on the whole learner; individualized instruction; theoretical framework and pedagogical implications; critical examination and interpretation of relevant curriculum guidelines.  Development of programs; analysis and application of specific teaching strategies and techniques unique to the discipline.  Evaluation procedures and techniques.
